textos_fuente.text: Pelican Palms Village | Mobile Home & RV Park | St. Petersburg FL Home Homes For Sale Campsites Available Amenities Activities Video Tour About Park Map Gallery Contact Apply For Residency (727) 323-4905 Resident Login Resident login Contact us via telephone (727) 323-4905 Resident Login A Thriving 55+ Manufactured Housing Community In St. Petersburg, Florida An Active, 55+ MH Community and RV Park Pelican Palms is a thriving manufactured housing community boasting 286 pads occupied by happy, long-term residents with select RV sites for guests. Located in St. Petersburg, FL about 17 miles southwest of Tampa and 7 miles east of the Gulf of Mexico, our grounds are convenient to the area’s great retail, dining and entertainment venues, various healthcare facilities and world-class attractions. Learn More Attractive Amenities Relax in our heated swimming pool or whirlpool spa–or meet up with friends at our spacious community clubhouse equipped with a commercial kitchen and relaxing lounge area. Up for a game of shuffleboard? Chances are, you’ll find plenty of friendly competitors ready to take you on! All Amenities Great location, nice pool, and reasonably priced laundromat on site. T.P | Google Review Family members live here very nice safe place. Love to be here, go walking, swimming, everything. Even holiday gatherings. The owners are great people and the property managers are even better. Love it! naeyma7 yemen | Google Review I love it, everyone is nice and polite. I wouldn’t trade my new place for a house. It’s very comfortable and I do have multiple areas where I can store my stuff. I have found a gold mine! Jean F. | Google Review Great place great neighbors lots of activities very close to downtown and very Central and Pinellas County Mj B. | Google Review What a lovely place this is! A friend lives here and I was visiting. The homes are well kept as are the grounds. The shuffleboard courts and swimming pool are great! Get free consultation with our school officer about your aviation career and find the best path to your goals. Ask on WhatsApp Explore Our Flight School – Watch the Video Welcome to Pelican Flight Training , Florida's premier flight school offering one of the best training programs for pilots from around the world. We offer a structured program that will take you all the way from private pilot rank to ATP and airline readiness. In this video, you'll learn what makes our flight school so special — the passion, the professionalism, and the world-class fleet of aircraft used for training. From your first flight to becoming a professional pilot, we will be with you every step of the way. Take a look right now and see why training at Pelican isn't just about learning — it's about transformation. Start Flying 2000+ Airplane Private Pilot Certifications 1500+ Airplane Commercial Pilot Certifications 1500+ Airplane Multi-Engine Pilot Certifications 1000+ Airplane Flight Instructor Certifications What Our Students Say ★★★★★ Louis Student I attended Pelican Flight Training at North Perry Airport in Pembroke Pines, Florida, starting in November 2021, and I also worked at the school afterward as a Flight Instructor. Throughout my training and teaching, the school played a crucial role in helping me achieve my goals. The instructors and the training standards they uphold their students to are very professional. I met fantastic people and learned a lot from the experience as well as my peers. Camilo Student I attended PFT as an international student F-1, and everything was pretty quick and easy. The staff from this school is beyond outstanding. I’m very thankful to Oleksandra and Anna, they’re very clear and extremely helpful at anytime. Instructors are very cool and good, facilities are fine, they provide you with advices and choices to do everything right. Overall very nice environment. Robert Student Pelican Flight Training is the best school around. I’ve tried other schools but Pelican is the most Professional my personal opinion. The atmosphere is so positive, the instructors are all so nice and friendly and I just passed my instrument Rating at Pelican and my instructor Adrian was TERRIFIC! And I am so looking forward to going back to start my commercial with them. More reviews on Google Maps → Pelican students life Request More Information Want to become a pilot? Get a free consultation today! Fill out the form and get a free PDF guide: ‘Your First Steps to an Airline Career’ ! We will be happy to personally assist you in making decision for your future airline career by providing you with all the information you might need and providing answers to all of your questions.  Please complete the form, and we will be in touch with you soon. About Us - Pelican Property Management Skip to content info@pelicanmgt.com Rental Properties Careers Internship Resident Portal Association Calendar About Services Community Forms Closing Documents Peli-Vision News Contact About Us About Us Rachel 2025-08-27T14:43:48-04:00 Jordan Andrew Levine, CMCA, AMS Jordan Levine, co-founder of Pelican Property Management, brings over 25 years of expertise in commercial real estate, finance, and community association management to the table. A Maryland native, Jordan earned a finance degree from Northeastern University before managing his family’s extensive real estate and retail portfolio. He later honed his skills with a master’s degree in Real Estate from Johns Hopkins University’s Edward St. John School of Real Estate. In 2008, he launched Myers Solomon Realty Corporation, a thriving full-service brokerage, before partnering with Joe Rector in 2013 to establish Pelican Property Management. Under his leadership, Pelican has grown from managing 6 units to over 14,000, revolutionizing the industry with innovative technology and resident-focused solutions. Jordan’s problem-solving mantra—”every challenge has a solution; you just have to think creatively”—drives his success. He holds CMCA (Certified Manager of Community Associations) and AMS (Association Management Specialist) designations from the Community Associations Institute and remains a visionary leader in transforming HOA management across Maryland. Jordan Levine President Joseph Rector Chief Executive Officer Joseph C. Rector Joseph “Joe” Rector, co-founder of Pelican Property Management, brings over 23 years of property management and real estate experience to his role, marked by a bold vision to redefine industry standards through quality, creativity, and commitment. Since partnering with Jordan Levine in 2013, Joe has been instrumental in growing Pelican into a Baltimore-area powerhouse, overseeing a diverse portfolio of HOAs, condominiums, and commercial properties. His hands-on approach and knack for turning around distressed properties—spanning high-end conventional buildings to community associations—have earned him a reputation as a transformative leader. Joe’s innovative management style, paired with his adoption of cutting-edge technology, keeps Pelican ahead of the curve. Beyond the office, he’s deeply engaged in his community, serving on the Board of Directors for The Cromwell Valley Park Council, consulting with Baltimore County, and maintaining ties with groups like The Living Classrooms Foundation and CAI Chesapeake Chapter. Named a Baltimore Business Journal Rising Star in 2014, Joe continues to blend his passion for the Chesapeake Bay—where he’s often found as an avid waterman—with his mission to build stronger, more connected communities. Who We Are Meet the Team Jim Miller Chief Operating Officer Rick Williams Chief Financial Officer David Hosmer Accountant Alex Jirsa Accountant Katie Desotell Accountant Sean Riley Accountant Sheila Elliott Accountant Phil Cohen Property Manager & Transition Coordinator Mick Buchanan Property Manager Michelle Cerny Property Manager Matt Cohen Property Manager Justin Moore Property Manager Jen Wilson Property Manager Joanne Frallicciardi Property Manager Julia Neph Property Manager Lea Ann Jones Property Manager Brendan O’Connell Property Manager Karim Kechrid Property Manager Dave O’Sullivan Property Manager Jon Blair Property Manager Bradley Blair Support Team Squadron Leader Amanda Jones Support Team Administrator Sam Cohen Support Team Administrator Erin Verenazi Support Team Administrator Sydney Pantazelos Support Team Administrator Tim Howell Director of Maintenance Baily Lynch Assistant Director of Maintenance Luis Amado Taquez Maintenance Technician Julio Machado Maintenance Technician Manuel Melara Maintenance Technician Mike Spigler Maintenance Technician Edwin Ventura Maintenance Technician Nelson Martinez Maintenance Technician Axel Cordon Sosa Maintenance Technician Derek Cernohorsky Maintenance Technician Rosa Quizar Maintenance Technician Archie Good Boy Joseph C. Rector Joseph Rector has over 15 years of experience in property management and real estate. Along with a vision to raise the industry expectations through quality, creativity, and commitment, Joe has brought a new type of management style to the table. Joe’s winning combination of his vast experience, personal approach, and successful management of diverse property types has proven invaluable to his clients. Joe has extensive experience successfully turning around distressed properties, ranging from high-end conventional properties, condominiums, and homeowners associations. Joe is active in his community, sits on the Board of Directors of The Cromwell Valley Park Council, consultant with Balt. County and maintains affiliations with: The Living Classrooms Foundation, BABB (Bel Air Business Builders), and CAI Chesapeake Chapter (Community Associations Institute). Joe was recognized by the Baltimore Business Journal as a Rising Star in 2014. An avid waterman, Joe spends much of his free time on the Chesapeake Bay. If you are looking for a dynamic and rewarding career, come talk to us. Contact Us CONTACT US Phone: 410-645-1865 Email: info@pelicanmgt.com HEADQUARTERS: THE NEST 8725 Loch Raven Blvd. Towson, MD 21286 410-645-1865 BUSINESS HOURS Monday to Friday 8:30am – 5:00pm Property Manager Portal Request a proposal © Copyright | Privacy Policy | Cookie Policy | Terms of Service | A Drio Duo Experience Page load link Go to Top

St. Petersburg mobile home park's new owner says there are no plans for change • St Pete Catalyst ST Pete's Business Daily (and a whole lot more) sign up for a free lifetime subscription And take your seat at the table Name Email Subscribe News Know Innovate Thrive Create Place Impact Venture Content SPG Insight Partner Stories Podcasts People Influencers The Hustle The Shuffle Organizations Connect Contribute Content Promote Your Business Meet the Team Support the Catalyst Events Community Voices Connect with us Type a text St Pete Catalyst News Know Innovate Thrive Create Place Impact Venture Content SPG Insight Partner Stories Podcasts People Influencers The Hustle The Shuffle Organizations Connect Contribute Content Promote Your Business Meet the Team Support the Catalyst Events Community Voices Know St. Petersburg mobile home park’s new owner says there are no plans for change Published 6 years ago on February 19, 2020 By Margie Manning Conner's Mobile Home Park at 2701 34th St. N. will be renamed Pelican Palms Village. One of the larger mobile home parks in St. Petersburg has a new owner. But unlike other area mobile home communities that have been acquired for redevelopment projects, Legacy Communities has no plans redevelop the property it just acquired, Conner’s Mobile Home Park at 2701 34 th St. N. “We’re not redevelopers,” Andrew Fells, chief operating officer at Legacy Communities, told the St. Pete Catalyst . “We plan to continue to operate it as a manufactured housing community. It’s what we’ve been doing for 20-plus years.” Conner’s Mobile Home Park, an age-restricted 55+ community with about 286 mobile home sites, sold Feb. 14 for $16.8 million, a deed filed with Pinellas County shows. The buyer, Legacy PIII Pelican LLC, took out a $13.4 million mortgage on the property that same day with with Walker & Dunlop, a Bethesda, Maryland-based commercial real estate finance firm. Legacy PIII Pelican LLC is a joint venture between Legacy Communities and PGIM Real Estate, a person familiar with the deal said. PGIM Real Estate is the real estate investment manager for Prudential Financials’ PGIM asset management business. The address listed on Legacy PIII Pelican’s deed and mortgage documents is that of PGIM Real Estate. Legacy Communities, headquartered in Sebring, Florida, owns and operates 21 mobile home communities and RV resorts around the United States. About half of them are in Florida. The Conner’s property is Legacy Communities’ first acquisition in the Tampa-St. Petersburg-Clearwater metro area. Legacy’s purchasing decisions mostly focus on specific properties instead of market presence, Fells said. “It’s not necessarily a specific market we look for. It’s a community we see that we like and that we are comfortable operating for the foreseeable future.” Legacy generally updates the common areas and amenities at the properties it acquires, and it plans to do so at the Conner’s property, although Fells didn’t want to be specific about what was in store. He planned to meet with residents Wednesday to introduce the company to them. Legacy also is changing the name of the property to Pelican Palms Village. A handful of other mobile home parks in St. Petersburg also have sold recently, and in at least some of the cases the new owner plans to redevelop the property. Most recently, Belleaire Development Group said it would build a new multi-family residential developmen t at the site of the former Lamplight Village mobile home park at 8700 4 th St. N. Nationally, mobile homes communities have become an increasingly popular tool for real estate managers to earn returns, according to a recent report in Pensions&Investments . After converting mobile home parks to institutional ownership, they can make improvements, increase income by raising rents and create portfolios that can be sold or spun off into real estate investment trusts, the report said. Those rent hikes have struck a nerve with many residents, who are living in the mobile home parks in part because they offer affordable housing. PGIM Real Estate, which has been investing in the sector for a couple of years in partnerships with operators, generally maintains below-market rates, Lee Menifee, managing director and head of Americas investment research at the firm, told Pensions&Investments . “We are mindful that manufactured housing communities are a source of affordable housing and it is our intent to maintain them as affordable,” Menifee said.             today CLOSE Aged Care Home Care Community Living Industry Topics Mergers & Acquisitions Editorial Development Government Policy Living with Dementia Health International Legal Issues Funding Housing News News & Headlines Awards Shares DCM Research Sector Moves & People Technology The Economy Saturday What's On Directory Meet the team Opinion Subscriptions About Contact © 2025 The Weekly SOURCE The Tuesday SOURCE Palm Lake to fast-track four new resorts in 2021 – including Pelican Waters community with hotel and high-end American-style ‘enclave’ Feb 09 2021 Updated
                                                        May 3, 2023 The Weekly Source 1 min read The largest private owner of retirement villages, land lease communities and aged care in Australia has gained support from the banks to accelerate its latest projects. “It means we will grow exponentially and be able to operate at an even faster pace,” Managing Director Scott Elliott says. Interestingly, Palm Lake CEO, Manuel Lang, was Palm Lake’s National Bank account manager before joining the group in 2012. The developments include: Its 320-home Pelican Waters project – due to start civil work in early 2021 – will feature the Group’s first hotel – adjacent to the 140ha Greg Norman-designed golf course they purchased alongside the 20ha development site in December 2018. Intriguingly, plans are also being made for a “very high-end”, 60-home separately gated enclave within the larger resort that Palm Lake anticipates will attract ‘snowbirds’ – people who would use their home in the community for the six warmer months of the year, similar to how wealthy Americans migrate to Hawaii, Mexico and the Caribbean. A 200-home community on a greenfield site at Paynesville, in Gippsland, Victoria, close to the town centre which is expected to begin construction at the end of 2021. A greenfield development with an 18-hole golf course at Old Bar Beach, near Taree, in NSW. A community at Forster Lakes (pictured above), which is already underway with the first stage of 44 homes and Country Club expected to be completed around May 2021. Founded 43 years ago in Victoria by Walter Elliott, Palm Lake now has 25 communities across QLD, NSW and Victoria with 11,000 residents and 1,300 staff. Retirement villages now need to capitalise on this moment. Here’s how. About Us | Pelican Lawn and Landscaping. Home Services Who We Serve About Us Contact Us Resources Careers Select Page About Us Delivering Top-Quality Workmanship & Accurate, Transparent Quotes View Our Work What We Do  Comprehensive Services We handle design, installation, and maintenance for flawless outdoor spaces.  Expert Care Specializing in irrigation, fertilization, pest control, tree trimming, and lighting.  Custom Solutions Serving associations, builders, commercial properties, and homeowners across Southwest Florida. About Pelican Lawn Care & Landscaping Pelican Lawn and Landscaping was established in 2006. We started out as a very small company and throughout the years have experienced tremendous success and growth. We now provide our services to many Associations, Builders, Commercial Properties and Single Family Home Owners throughout Southwest Florida. If you reside in the Southwest Florida area, you must call Pelican Lawn and Landscaping to receive your FREE consultation. We are the premier lawn and landscape company in Estero, Fort Myers, Bonita Springs, and Naples. At Pelican Lawn and Landscaping, we pride ourselves on delivering exceptional quality in every project. Our skilled team uses top-notch materials and techniques to ensure your outdoor spaces are both beautiful and functional. We offer detailed, transparent quotes for all services, ensuring no surprises and excellent value. For unmatched landscaping quality in Southwest Florida, trust Pelican Lawn and Landscaping. Contact Us Our Team Marco Marco is a German citizen and moved from Switzerland to Bonita Springs in 2015. After receiving his master’s degree in finance he’s worked for more than 20 years in Swiss Private Banking and Family Offices. He decided to move to Florida for personal reasons and purchased Pelican Lawn & Landscaping on January 1st, 2016. Marco is a very customer-oriented individual, and he wants to bring the customer service, customer satisfaction and communication to a higher level. He is solution driven; always trying to find new ideas to satisfy the customer’s needs. Today, with his high performing management team, he wants to grow the company but aim to remain a “family” size company where the customer needs and satisfaction must always drive our decisions and actions. He strongly believes that each customer is important and must receive the best level of service possible. – Marco Schauenburg, President & Owner Leo Vargas Leo has been in the Agriculture Industry for 20 years, 15 of those years in the lawn and landscaping industry. His family has a long history of working in the Agriculture Industry, and it can be said that he grew up within it. He was born and raised in sunny South Florida in the small city of Homestead and always had a passion for this work. Leo is eager to continue building his expertise and contributing to the industry he loves. – Leo Vargas, Account Manager Kathy Moran Kathy is originally from Michigan and moved to Florida in 1999 to escape the cold winters looking for warmer weather and sunshine. She has worked in the Accounting field for 38 years; she started out at a small business that sold rust proofing products to the auto industry. She has worked as the Office Manager for Pelican Lawn & Landscaping, Inc. since 2011 prior to Marco purchasing the company. She believes in Marco’s ideals regarding strengthening the relationships with all our customers through better customer service and communication. – Kathy Moran, Office Manager Arnold Ramirez Arnold has over 20 years in landscape management, he is all about creating lasting relationships and delivering top-notch service. As a General Manager, he works alongside our teams to ensure every client feels heard, respected, and thrilled with our results. His focus is on building trust, making a positive impact, and fostering open communication every step of the way. He believes in a hands-on approach, always going the extra mile, and making meaningful connections. When clients succeed, he succeeds, and that’s what drives him every day. Outside of work, he loves spending time with his wife and children; he has two daughters and a young son. Teaching them strong values and how to be good, responsible people is important to him, as he aims to raise a family that contributes positively to the community. He is also an avid hunter and fisherman, and loves being outdoors, experiencing nature at its best. – Arnold Ramirez, General Manager “I have been very impressed with the professionalism, knowledge, and service that your company has provided. The staff has transformed our OK landscape into the best-landscaped home in our community. I can’t thank you all enough for the tremendous service we have provided. You should be very proud of your services” Residents in the Mediterra Community, Naples, FL “I have been very impressed with the professionalism, knowledge, and service that your company has provided. The staff has transformed our OK landscape into the best-landscaped home in our community. I can’t thank you all enough for the tremendous service we have provided. You should be very proud of your services” Residents in the Mediterra Community, Naples, FL “I have been very impressed with the professionalism, knowledge, and service that your company has provided. The staff has transformed our OK landscape into the best-landscaped home in our community. I can’t thank you all enough for the tremendous service we have provided. You should be very proud of your services” Residents in the Mediterra Community, Naples, FL Who Are We Pelican Lawn & Landscaping has been proudly serving Southwest Florida since 2006. Our expert team is dedicated to providing top-quality landscaping services tailored to the unique needs of our region. Trust us to create and maintain beautiful, resilient outdoor spaces for your property. Hours Monday – Friday 7 am – 4 pm Saturday – Sunday Closed Contact Us  (239) 495-4553  office@pelicanlawn.com
